While it can feel uncomfortable, the people who answer suicide hotlines are trained to assist, even if you're feeling very sad but not necessarily suicidal.

I'm currently learning to surf. I can easily manage waves that are 1-2 feet high, but when the waves reach 2-3 feet, I struggle to surf effectively. What are the best ways to improve?

Surfing can be challenging! Here are some important aspects to keep in mind as the waves grow larger: 1) wave positioning—you should aim to catch the wave at the correct angle, 2) stance—maintain your weight farther back as the wave becomes steeper, and 3) pop-up timing—try to pop up more quickly on steeper wave faces. I hope these tips are useful, and keep practicing!
